page.title: 04MORE DOWNLAND PLANTS
page.content: Grass grows freely along the paths & rides of the downs & the chalk contains many plants typical of lowland pastures as well as its own distinctive species. Downland grasses in this block are: Ribwort plantain, Creeping Red Fescue, Cocksfoot, Tufted Sheep's Fescue, Sedge & Quaking grass. Taller grasses include Upright Brome, which shields butterflies & grasshoppers from their enemies, & Common & Downy Oatgrass. Without grazing the coarse grasses:- Tor grass, False oat, Timothy, Fiorin & Cosksfoot spread & smother flowers. Heyshott Down is one of the very special sites where mosses can still be found. One species is Feathermoss which gives grazed downland turf a spongy carpet-pile feel. Chalk land is not rich in fungi & only puff balls & Clitocybe Nebularis were found.
